description:
India, 20 April, 2020, regarding fixation of package rates of COVID-19 treatment in Private Medical Colleges and Hospitals of Haryana and to state the mode of payment for treatment of COVID-19 patients at private COVID4 9 hospitals. The patients/ suspects of COVID-19 are categorised into 4 categories and mode of payment for each of the categories is given below: 
1. Govt. Employees, Pensioners and their dependents-The Govt. Employees, Pensioners and their dependents would avail treatment as per the State Government' existing Reimbursement/ Cashless/ Empanelment policies, as the case may be. 
2. Persons having Govt./Private health insurance-The Persons having health insurance would avail treatment as per the terms & conditions of the individual policy. 3. Beneficiaries of Ayushman Bharat (AB) Scheme-The beneficiaries of AB scheme would avail treatment on cashless basis, as per the existing AB Scheme. The COVID hospital shall charge as per the existing AB scheme and submit bills directly to Ayushman Bharat, Haryana. 4. Persons, which do not come under all the above 3 categories-Such persons i.e. Patients/Suspects approaching Govt. Health facilities and then referred to COVID-19 hospitals (Government/Private), which do not fit in all 3 above mentioned categories, would avail treatment on cashless basis.

description:
In India, Rajasthan Government on April 19, 2020 allowed the industries/enterprises located in rural areas to start working. It announced that arrangements will be made for movement passes for the identified vehicles for transportation to the industries/enterprises established in these areas to bring their workers (as per the minimum requirement) to the factory premises.

-These passes will be given by the Regional Manager of RIICO in the RIICO industrial areas and GM (DIC) in other areas. For this, applications can be made either online or on the RajCop Citizen Mobile App or offline. Already existing or approved industries will be able to operate as before and their passes will also remain valid.
type_text: Arrangements for movement passes for the identified vehicles for transportation
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: India, 1 May, 2020, Due to the spread of COVID-19 & nationwide lockdown, moreover in compliance with GOI notification vide V11011/01/2020 dated 17-04-2020, all the centres registered under PCPNDT Act, 1994 are directed to ensure that all its provisions are followed and all reports, records mandatory to be maintained/prepared as per the Law with due sincerity. All report submissions failing due in this period i.e. till 30-06-2020 shall be submitted by the 5th July, 2020. Wherever possible, electronic communication and electronic report filling should continue on an ongoing basis even before 30-06-2020.

description:
India, 1 May,2020, It is brought out for information of all that a portal for registration of stranded migrants, students, tourists etc has been developed by Chandigarh Administration. It is accessible from website of Chandigarh Administration http://Chandigarh.gov.in or can be accessed on the link http://admser.chd.nic.in/migrant Sh Rajiv Tewari has been made the Nodal Officer for Migrant Persons of other states stranded in Chandigarh and for Chandigarh residents stranded in other states. A stranded person has to fill in the basic details and submit after giving OTP received on his mobile. Alternatively, for the convenience of persons who are unable to do it themselves, the facility has been provided through Call Centre of Administration available on helpline
number 1800-180-2067 where the details can be provided telephonically (from 8.00 am to 8.00 pm) daily.

description: India, 1 June, 2020, To avoid and pre-empt the spread of the COVID-19 Pandemic, the following will be the guidelines to be followed by all Hair Salon/ Barber-shops operating within the territorial jurisdiction of Union Territory of Chandigarh.  Guidelines for Opening / operating Hair Salon /Barber-shop:The waste generated in these premises will be kept in three separate bins/bags-(i) Green- all bio-degradable like cut hairs/cotton/used paper sheet / paper-cups etc; (ii) Blue-all non bio-degradable (except matel) like plastic sheets /polythene etc & (iii) Yellow-all Sharp and Hazardous waste like Blades/disposable razors etc.

description:
India, 1 June, 2020, To avoid and pre-empt the spread of the COVID-19 Pandemic, the following will be the guidelines to be followed by all Hair Salon/ Barber-shops operating within the territorial jurisdiction of Union Territory of Chandigarh. Guidelines for Visitors /Clients Customers:  
A. No person having any symptom of COVID 19 like High Temperature, fever, cough, cold, throat pain, difficulty in breathing shall visit these facilities. B. No person who is COVID-19 Positive or under Home Quarantine /Institutional Quarantine/ Isolation shall use these facilities. C. Prefer prior appointment for availing services. D. Prefer Digital mode (Internet banking /BHIM/Paytm etc.) of payment for paying bills E. Use Face Mask while using services. F. Wash your hands, cloths and take a bath after availing service to avoid further spread of infection. G. Don't keep your wallet /mobile phone etc. on any surface /slab in shop. H. Prefer minimum visit only when it is utmost necessary.

description:
India, 23 June, 2020, Whereas due to increasing cases of COVID 19, it is imperative to regulate the movement of persons who are coming to UT,Chandigarh from outside the Tri-city and stay for more than three days. Therefore, the following orders are issued under Section 24 of Disaster Management Act, 2005 which will come into force WITH IMMEDIATE EFFECT:- For visitors, who are visiting Chandigarh and staying as house guests or with friends/relatives etc., it shall be mandatory for the person hosting the visitors to register their details on portal http://admser.chd.nic.in/visitregis/ immediately, on the same day of their arrival, if the visitors have not already done so.
5. Management of hotels/guest houses/corporate guest houses/govt. rest houses/dharamshalas etc. shall register the details of visitors from outside Chandigarh staying with them on the portal mentioned above immediately as soon as they check-in, if the visitors have not already done so. They should not be allowed accommodation unless they have downloaded Aarogya Setu Application.

They should not be allowed accommodation unless they have downloaded Aarogya Setu Application.

description: India, 8 April, 2020, It is brought out for information of all that it is NOT RECOMMENDED to consume HCQS (Hydroxychloroquine) drug by public for prevention of Coronavirus infection. HCQS (Hydroxychloroquine) , which is a derivative of antimalarial drug chloroquine is now widely thought be a remedy or a game changer in the management of Covid 19 in public perception. However, fact is that this drug has no role in prevention of Coronavirus infection, for which only remedies are as already being emphasised. If at all, it has any role, it is in Covid 19 patients where it may enhance the response of supportive treatment. For it also there is not sufficient evidence. In fact this drug has serious side-effects on the heart . At the moment this drug cannot be recommended to be consumed by public for prevention of Coronavirus infection.
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: "On 14th March 2020, the Government of Maharashtra under the provision of Epidemic Diseases Act,1897 announced the 'The Maharashtra COVID-19 Regulations, 2020' under which the person who has any history of travel to affected areas in last 14 days and he/she is asymptomatic, he/she must remain in home quarantine for 14 days from the day of exposure. He/she must abide by the Home Quarantine Guidelines issued by the Ministry of Health & Family Welfare, Government of India meticulously. Persons who do not observe the Home Quarantine Guidelines shall be quarantined in the quarantine facilities set up by the Government. A person with a travel history and symptoms as per the case definition of COVID-19 must be isolated in a hospital as per protocol and he/she will be tested for COVID-19 as per protocol. These stipulations of duration & symptoms may undergo changes based on advisories issued by the Government of India.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
On 19th March 2020, Telangana State government in India advised that any person who has returned from COVID-19 affected countries or has been in personal contact with such person must remain in home isolation for 14 days from the time of arrival in India irrespective of having any symptoms or not.

UPDATE: On 20th March 2020, Telangana Government in India has made it mandatory for any person who has been in contact with a confirmed case of COVID-19 or is family contact of any person returning from a foreign country must remain in home isolation for next 14 days. UPDATE: The original policy has been ended on 20th March 2020 as the target population for this policy has been changed from 'COVID-19 affected countries' to 'any foreign country'.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: WHO has declared the outbreak of COVID-19 as pandemic, India, Haryana have two International Airports i.e. IGI Airport, New Delhi and Chandigarh International Airport in vicinity. There are more than 6600 persons under the surveillance in Haryana. Therefore, it is imperative to adopt strict social distancing and isolation measures to contain the spread of COVID-I9, which is playing havoc in many countries across the world. A majority of these returnees are from the revenue districts of Haryana namely Gurugram, Faridabad, Sonipat, Panipat, Jhajjar, Rohtak, panchkula etc.

description:
India, the Government of Haryana, in exercise of powers conferred under section 2,3 and 4 of the Epidemic Disease Act, 1897, has framed the Haryana COVID-I9 Regulation, 2020 for prevention and containment of Corona virus disease, 2019 (COVID-19).
Under section 2 of the Epidemic Disease Act, 1897 and regulation made thereof , the Government of Haryana hereby notifies the following restriction:
All foreign returnees are directed to remain under strict home quarantine for a period as decided by local Health Authorities
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On 22nd March 2020, the Government of India administration of Lakshadweep issued regulation that if any person has any history of travel in any country/ state or area where Covid-19 has been reported or any history of having close contact with a suspected or confirmed case of COVID-19 shall be recorded within 14 days and the person must be kept in home quarantine for 14 days from the day of exposure. 

This regulation came in to force with immediate effect on 22nd March 2020 and shall remain valid for a period of one year from the date of issue or until further orders. 

Any such person refuses to co-operate with, render assistance to or comply with the directions of the Surveillance Personnel, the Concerned SDO / Executive Magistrate having jurisdiction, may pass an appropriate order and may be proceeded under section133 of the Code of Criminal Procedure,1973 (2 of 1974) or take any other coercive action as deemed necessary.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
India, 24 April, 2020, State is doing many efforts. Major
steps/activities have been undertaken in the State for prevention & control of COVID-19.
In this regard, State is keeping a close eye on all persons coming from other Nations and States.
However it has come to light, that students who are resident of Haryana are coming back from Kota (Rajasthan) to their hometowns.
In order to be extra observant and to prevent the spread to COVID 19 ,
l. It is instructed to screen each and every student coming from above mentioned place and quarantine them as per protocol.
2. If any symptoms found among the students, same should be managed as per COVID 19 protocol and be reported on online portal.
3. They should be advised that in case, they develop any symptoms of Flu,he/she immediately report at the State helpline no. 8558893911/ District Helpline no. 1075, 108 and any other if available list attached )
4. Each student may be shared all Do's and Don'ts regarding quarantine
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: India, The karnataka state government on 22 May 2020 said returnees from six states with high COVID-19 cases which are Maharashtra, Gujarat, Delhi, Tamil Nadu, Rajasthan and Madhya Pradesh  will be kept in institutional quarantine for seven days. After they test negative for the disease in pool testing, they will be sent for home quarantine for another seven days.However home quarantine is allowed for pregnant ladies, people above 80 years, patients with comorbidities and children below 10 years of age, along with one attendant after they test negative.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
India, 23 June, 2020, Whereas due to increasing cases of COVID 19, it is imperative to regulate the movement of persons who are coming to UT,Chandigarh from outside the Tri-city and stay for more than three days. Therefore, the following orders are issued under Section 24 of Disaster Management Act, 2005 which will come into force WITH IMMEDIATE EFFECT:-Quarantine Norms:
a. For symptomatic persons on arrival. He/ She shall report to the nearest health facility and will be assessed for clinical severity;
ii. On testing, if found positive, he/she will be shifted to home isolation/COVID care Centre/dedicated COVID Hospital (DCH) depending upon the severity; and If negative, no further test/self isolation required, however self-home quarantine will be done.
b.Asymptomatic persons on arrival: There shall be mandatory 14 days of self-home quarantine for all visitors outside Tri-city. In case of development of any symptoms, the person concerned shall inform the District Surveillance Officer of the State National call centre/helpline at 9779558282 for further medical treatment.
c.Exceptions: All persons visiting Chandigarh for a period of less than 72 hours for business/business related activities, will not be subject to quarantine, on production of return journey plan.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Persons traveling outside the state of Assam in India and arriving back within 72 hours are not required to quarantine for 10 days if they fulfill these conditions: get a rapid antigen test upon return, if the test result is positive they will go through isolation per protocol, if the rapid antigen test result is negative, swab sample will be taken for RT-PCR test and person will be needed to stay in isolation until test result comes back. If test result is positive they will go through isolation per protocol, if negative they will not be required to isolate. The person is also required to follow hygiene and social distancing norms during their stay outside of Assam starting 30th October 2020. UPDATE: The original policy allowed people traveling outside of the state and returning within 96 hours to avoid quarantine if tested, it has been changed to 72 hours with the same protocols of negative testing.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
India, the Government of Haryana, in exercise of powers conferred under section 2,3 and 4 of the Epidemic Disease Act, 1897, has framed the Haryana COVID-I9 Regulation, 2020 for prevention and containment of Corona virus disease, 2019 (COVID-19).
Under section 2 of the Epidemic Disease Act, 1897 and
regulation made thereof , the Government of Haryana hereby notifies the following restriction until 31 March 2020:
All shops, commercial establishments, offices and factories, workshops, godowns etc. shall close their operations except for essential services mentioned in para below.
However, the following establishments providing essential services shall be excluded from the above restriction:
a)Bank/ATM.
b)Print, Electronic and Social Media.
c)Telecom & lnternet Services including IT & ITeS.
d)Postal services.
e)E-Commerce (delivery) of all essential goods including food, pharmaceutical and
medical equipment.
f)Food, Groceries, Milk, Bread, Fruit, Vegetable, Meat, Fish, Atta etc. and their transportation related activities and warehousing.
g)Take away/home delivery restaurants/ eateries.
h)Petrol pumps, LPG gas, Oil agencies, their godown Viand their transportation related activities.
institution_status: This type of business ("Retail Businesses") is allowed to open with no conditions attached
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
India, the Government of Haryana, in exercise of powers conferred under section 2,3 and 4 of the Epidemic Disease Act, 1897, has framed the Haryana COVID-I9 Regulation, 2020 for prevention and containment of Corona virus disease, 2019 (COVID-19).
Under section 2 of the Epidemic Disease Act, 1897 and
regulation made thereof , the Government of Haryana hereby notifies the following restriction until 31 March 2020:
All shops, commercial establishments, offices and factories, workshops, godowns etc. shall close their operations except for essential services mentioned in para below.
However, the following establishments providing essential services shall be excluded from the above restriction:
a)Bank/ATM.
b)Print, Electronic and Social Media.
c)Telecom & lnternet Services including IT & ITeS.
d)Postal services.
e)E-Commerce (delivery) of all essential goods including food, pharmaceutical and
medical equipment.
f)Food, Groceries, Milk, Bread, Fruit, Vegetable, Meat, Fish, Atta etc. and their transportation related activities and warehousing.
g)Take away/home delivery restaurants/ eateries.
h)Petrol pumps, LPG gas, Oil agencies, their godown Viand their transportation related activities.

description:
In the territorial jurisdiction of the entire UT of Chandigarh in public interest w.e.f. 00:00 hrs on 23.03.2020 until 2400 hrs on March 31, 2020. These prohibitory measures will constrain the worker / employees of Private Establishments/Industries/Factories/Shops etc. to report for work. There may be such incidence that on this pretext, the employer may dispense with the services of the workers or may force the workers / employees to go on leave without wages/ salaries. 
Now, therefore, in exercise of the Epidemic Diseases, COVID-19 Regulation, 2020 issued by the Administrator, UT Chandigarh:- 
"The employees of private Establishments / Industries / Factories / Shops etc. (including temporary /casual /contractual /outsourced /daily-wage workers) who are required to stay at home in view of the orders of Chandigarh Administration shall be treated as 'on duty' and be paid in full".
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

India, 21 April, 2020, The Chandigarh is in the red zone/containment area. The Lead District Manager (LDM) was asked vide mail dated 18.04.2020 that he should give proposal for opening minimum number of Bank Branches without causing any health risk to Bank Employees. Chlef Load District Manager now vide his email date: 20.4.2020 has given proposal to open 50%. Bank branches on alternative days And operation of certain essential bank activities on daily basis. In view of the proposal of Chief Lead District Manager, it has been decided That - 
(1) All Controlling Offices/Bank offices Currency Chest branches, Treasury Branches, Loan Processing cells, Forex Branches and Cheque Clearing/Processing Centers shall open an daily basis with 50% staff strength.2) All ATM operations, BC (Bank Correspondents) should be operational on daily basis. 3) Cash in transit cash replenishment agencies / IT and Engineering support vendors for banks shall be operational on daily basis. (4) All other Branches will open on alternate days (as per schedule annexed) with 50% staff strength.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Other Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
India, 24 April, 2020, in exercise of powers conferred under Section 144 of the Cr PC hereby order that one person from every house will be allowed to step out of their houses on foot between 10:00 AM to 2 00 PM daily till further orders, to visit their nearest shops or supermarkets selling grocery/Kiryana. fruits & vegetables, eggs, meat & fish, milk, chemist. etc which are hereby allowed to remain open during this exemption period for direct sale The timings for these shops to cater to home delivery will be fixed separately by the appropriate authority/authorities Rest of the conditions of order dated 27-03-2020 shall remain same. Any breach of the order shall invite action under Section 188 of Indian Penal Code. It is reiterated that social distancing norms must be strictly adhered to by the shopkeepers as well as by the general public Executive Magistrates. Police and Sector Response Teams will also ensure the strict enforcement of social distancing norms as prescribed by Health Department. This order shall come into force from zero hours of 24-04-2020 and remain valid till 
further orders.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Supermarkets/grocery stores") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: India on 28 April 2020, Bengluru, Karnataka.The Karnataka government eased restrictions for industries located in rural areas in a few more districts, taking the total number of such districts to 14. With this, industries located in rural areas (outside the limits of municipal corporations and municipalities) have been allowed to operate their activities in Chamarajanagar, Koppal, Chikkamagaluru, Raichur, Chitradurga, Ramanagaram, Hassan, Shivamogga, Haveri, Yadgir, Kolar, Davangere, Udupi, and Kodagu districts. Also, All shops registered under the Shops and Establishments Act of the State, including shops in residential complexes and market complexes, can open with 50% strength of the workers by wearing of masks and following social distancing norms.

description:
India, The following activities will continue to remain prohibited across the
country, irrespective of the Zone, for a period of two weeks with effect
from 4th May,2020: a)Hospitality services other than those used for housing health/ police/ Government officials/ healthcare workers, stranded persons including tourists,and those used for quarantine facilities.
b)All cinema halls, shopping malls, gymnasiums, sports complexes, swimming pools, entertainment parks, theatres, bars and auditoriums, assembly halls and similar places. Barber shops, spas and salons.
c)In Containment Zones, Out-Patient Departments (OPDs) and Medical clinics shall not be permitted to operate. However, these may be permitted to operate in Red, Orange and Green Zones, with social distancing norms and other safety precautions.
institution_status: This type of business  ("${lm://Field/1}") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
India, Govt. of Haryana stated that The following activities shall be permitted with restrictions as specified: 
a)Industrial establishments in urban areas: Only Special Economic Zones（SEZs), Export Oriented Units (EOUs), industrial estates and industrial townships with access control; Manufacturing units of essential goods, including drugs, pharmaceuticals, medical devices, their raw material and intermediates; Production units, which require continuous process, and their supply chain; Manufacturing of IT hardware; Jute industry with staggered shifts and social distancing; and, Manufacturing units of packaging material are permitted. All industrial activities are permitted in rural areas. 
b)Construction activities in urban areas: Only in situ construction (where
workers are available on site and no workers are required to be brought in from outside) and construction of renewable energy projects are
permitted. All construction activities are permitted in rural areas.
c)E-commerce activities will be permitted only in respect of essential
goods.
d)Private offices can operate with upto 33% strength as per requirement, with the remaining persons working from home.
institution_status: This type of business  ("Construction") is allowed to open with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: India on 19 May 2020, Bengaluru, Karnataka. Under lockdown 4.0, the Karnataka government has permitted the opening of barber shops, spas, parlors, and salons. These establishments will have to strictly abide by the Standard Operating Procedure issued by the Department of Health and Family Welfare. As per the SOP, persons with fever, cold, cough and throat pain should not be allowed on the premises. Those without masks, including staff members, should not be permitted inside, while all the staff have to wear masks, head cover, and apron at all times, apart from sanitizing hands after every haircut.

19.03.2020 issued by the Government of India, Ministry of Personnel, Public Grievances and Pensions, Department of Personnel & Training, the following further instructions are issued for strict compliance:- 
i) Heads of Department (HoD) may ensure that 50% of Group B, C and D employees are required to attend office every day, and the remaining 50% staff should be instructed to work from home. All HODs are advised to draft a weekly roster of duty for Group B, C and D staff and ask them to attend office on alternate weeks. description:
India, the Government of Haryana, in exercise of powers conferred under section 2,3 and 4 of the Epidemic Disease Act, 1897, has framed the Haryana COVID-I9 Regulation, 2020 for prevention and containment of Corona virus disease, 2019 (COVID-19).
Under section 2 of the Epidemic Disease Act, 1897 and
regulation made thereof , the Government of Haryana hereby notifies the following restriction until 31 March 2020:
All shops, commercial establishments, offices and factories, workshops, godowns etc. shall close their operations except for essential services mentioned in para below.
However, the following establishments providing essential services shall be excluded from the above restrictions:
a) Government offices/ establishments as per the instructions of Chief Secretary Office.
b)Electricity, Water, Sewerage and Municipal Services.
c)Hospitals, Chemist shops, Optical stores, Pharmaceuticals manufacturing units including mask and sanitization material manufacturing units and their transportation related activities.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
India, 28 March 2020, DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC RELATIONS
CHANDIGARH ADMINISTRATION. It is brought out for information of all that to ensure that there is smooth supply of LPG Cylinders to residents/ Households in Chandigarh, the Administration has taken steps to steamline the process in the present situation.
Total 12180 LPG Cylinders were delivered by the Gas Agencies, wherein 8600 were supplied by IOCL, 1430 by HPCL and 2150 BPCL. The Administration assures all the residents that the supply of LPG Cylinders in the city will be maintained and there is no need to panic.
However, it is clarified that NO individual is allowed to visit any Gas agency for buying/ refilling LPG Cylinder. The residents can only place order telephonically for delivery of LPG Cylinder at their doorstep. In case anyone is found violating the provision, then strict legal action would be taken against both the individual and the shop owner as per law.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
Dumka (a district in the Indian state of Jharkhand), defined the government services that would remain operational during the lockdown, as follows:
1) Law and order agencies - to function without any restrictions
2) Officers attendance - compulsory for grade 'A' and 'B' officers, reduced to 33% for grade 'C' and below.
4) District administration and treasury officials -  to function with restricted staff.
5) Wildlife and forest officers - to function after taking necessary precautions.

description:
In India , Rajasthan Government on May 31, 2020 issued guidelines saying the lockdown for ‘all religious places/ places of worship  will continue for the period June 1 to June 30, 2020. UPDATE: Government of Rajasthan on Sept 07, 2020 announced that all the religious places, including those in urban areas and the
bigger ones will be reopened.
-Devotees won’t be allowed to bring flowers, fruits and sweets (for offering and distribution of prasad), other stuff (required for worshipping) to these places and also ring the bells.
-Moreover, no religious processions will be allowed.
- Also, for violation of Covid norms and the guidelines issued by the state’s home department, the religious places could be closed down by the district collector.
-On top of that, religious places will not be opened in containment zones
and the areas under curfew. According to the guidelines issued by the
home department, before opening the bigger religious places, the district
collector, district superintendent of police (SP) and chief medical and
health officer (CMHO) must conduct an inspection to ensure Covid safety
norms are followed and precautionary measures are taken by their management.
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 4th April 2021, the Government of Maharashtra under the provision of the Epidemic Act 1897 announced the closure of all beaches/ gardens/ public grounds from 8 PM to 7 AM on weekdays and from 8 PM Friday to 7 AM Monday. The policy comes in effect from 8 pm on 5th April 2021 and will continue till 30th April 2021. Between 7 AM to 8 PM on Monday to Friday, visitors follow strictly Covid Appropriate Behaviour. Local authorities to ensure that such places are closely supervised and in case of crowding occurring in such locations to a point where the local authorities feel that it behaviour of visitors is not disciplined and may lead to transmission/ spread of the COVID-19 virus, then they may close down the same.

description:
India, In exercise of powers conferred under 'The Haryana Epidemic Disease Act 1897, following directions are hereby issued in the State of Haryana with immediate effect:

All children below 10 years of age to remain at home and avoid going to public parks, picnics, and other games requiring large no. of participants.

description:
U.T Chandigarh in exercise of powers vested with me under Section 144 of Cr.Pc. do hereby order as an emergency measure that there is prohibition on gathering of 5 or more person at Public Places Any breach of this order would invite action under Section 188 of Indian Penal Code 
In view of the emergent nature of the order, it is being issued Ex-parte and is addressed to the public in general. 
This order shall come into force with effect from 9.00 PM on 22.03.2020 and shall be effective up to 12.00 midnight on 22.03.2020.
type_sub_cat: Other mass gatherings not specified above restricted
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
The state government has issued a statement regarding the famous holy place in J&K named as Veshno Devi .
 Public Announcements are being made through public address systems at the base camp in Katra town,  that anyone with symptons of coronovirus like should immediately contact the medical officers at several dispensaries managed by the Board. UPDATE: he number of pilgrims permitted to visit the Vaishno Devi shrine has also been revised. Now, the maximum number of people who can visit the hilltop shrine is set at 25,000. However, people with co-morbidities and senior citizens have been advised to practice extra precaution in view of the virus.

description:
Ministry of Home Affairs issues advisory to all States/Union Territories to make adequate arrangements for migrant workers, students, etc from outside the States to facilitate Social Distancing for COVID-19. 

- The advisory suggests that in order to mitigate the situation for unorganized sector workers, particularly stranded migrant workers, States/UTs need to explore measures by involving various agencies, including NGOs, to provide food and shelter with basic amenities like clean drinking water, sanitation, etc. 
- MHA has also advised that States/ UTs need to ensure that hotels, rented accommodations, hostels, etc., continue to remain functional and delivery of essential items is streamlined, so that students, working women hostel inmates, etc. are allowed to continue in existing facilities while observing precautions.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description: In India, the Delhi province decided on 04-08-2020,  to make mask wearing essential to any person moving in public supported by studies showing the effectiveness of masks in preventing spread of Covid - 19 from and to persons coming contact to each other, apart from compulsory social distancing measures. Use of 3 ply mask/home made cloth masks is made compulsory in all working places,markets,inside personal or official vehicles and made punishable under section 188 of Indian penal code.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
India, 9 April, 2020, In exercise of power conferred under Section 22 of the Disaster Management ACT, 2005, the undersigned, in his capacity as Chairperson State Executive Committee Union Territory of Chandigarh hereby directs the following measures. 
1. All persons moving for whatsoever purpose and under whatever reason/authority in public places, like street, hospital. office, and markets must wear 3-ply mask or cloth mask compulsorily 2. Any person moving around in his personal and official vehicle must be wearing these masks compulsorily 3. It is mandatory for wearing of masks for persons working at any site/office/workplace etc 4 No person/officeriofficials will attend any meeting/gathering without wearing these masks. 5_ These masks may be standard mask available with the chemist or even homemade washable masks and can be reused after proper washing and disinfecting them 
It shall be the responsibility of the employer to ensure that his/her employees wear the 3-ply mask or cloth mask without fail Anybody violating these instructions will be punishable under the Section 188 of Indian Penal Code (48 of 1860) and the Police Authorities are empowered to immediately arrest the violators These instructions must be followed scrupulously.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Dumka (a district in the Indian state of Jharkhand), defined the government services that would remain operational during the lockdown, as follows:
1) Law and order agencies - to function without any restrictions
2) Officers attendance - compulsory for grade 'A' and 'B' officers, reduced to 33% for grade 'C' and below.
4) District administration and treasury officials -  to function with restricted staff.
5) Wildlife and forest officers - to function after taking necessary precautions.

target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: India on 28 April 2020, Bengluru, Karnataka.The Karnataka government eased restrictions for industries located in rural areas in a few more districts, taking the total number of such districts to 14. With this, industries located in rural areas (outside the limits of municipal corporations and municipalities) have been allowed to operate their activities in Chamarajanagar, Koppal, Chikkamagaluru, Raichur, Chitradurga, Ramanagaram, Hassan, Shivamogga, Haveri, Yadgir, Kolar, Davangere, Udupi, and Kodagu districts. Also, All shops registered under the Shops and Establishments Act of the State, including shops in residential complexes and market complexes, can open with 50% strength of the workers by wearing of masks and following social distancing norms.
city: Chamarajanagar, Koppal, Chikkamagaluru, Raichur, Chitradurga, Ramanagaram, Hassan, Shivamogga, Haveri, Yadgir, Kolar, Davangere, Udupi, and Kodagu districts

target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: India on 1 May 2020, Bengaluru, Karnataka. Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), the local civic authority, has made it mandatory for citizens to wear masks in public areas and work spaces. As per the order, wearing a facial mask to cover mouth and nose is compulsory in public places and in any working space with more than 5 people. While violators not wearing masks, and those indulging in acts such as spitting, urinating and littering in public places will be fined Rs 1,000 for the first violation, the fine will be doubled to Rs 2,000 for the second and subsequent violations.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
India, The following activities will continue to remain prohibited across the
country, irrespective of the Zone, for a period of two weeks with effect
from 4th May,2020: a)Hospitality services other than those used for housing health/ police/ Government officials/ healthcare workers, stranded persons including tourists,and those used for quarantine facilities.
b)All cinema halls, shopping malls, gymnasiums, sports complexes, swimming pools, entertainment parks, theatres, bars and auditoriums, assembly halls and similar places. Barber shops, spas and salons.
c)In Containment Zones, Out-Patient Departments (OPDs) and Medical clinics shall not be permitted to operate. However, these may be permitted to operate in Red, Orange and Green Zones, with social distancing norms and other safety precautions.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Private health offices
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
India, Govt. of Haryana stated that The following activities shall be permitted with restrictions as specified: 
a)Industrial establishments in urban areas: Only Special Economic Zones（SEZs), Export Oriented Units (EOUs), industrial estates and industrial townships with access control; Manufacturing units of essential goods, including drugs, pharmaceuticals, medical devices, their raw material and intermediates; Production units, which require continuous process, and their supply chain; Manufacturing of IT hardware; Jute industry with staggered shifts and social distancing; and, Manufacturing units of packaging material are permitted. All industrial activities are permitted in rural areas. 
b)Construction activities in urban areas: Only in situ construction (where
workers are available on site and no workers are required to be brought in from outside) and construction of renewable energy projects are
permitted. All construction activities are permitted in rural areas.
c)E-commerce activities will be permitted only in respect of essential
goods.
d)Private offices can operate with upto 33% strength as per requirement, with the remaining persons working from home.
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: India on 19 May 2020, Bengaluru, Karnataka. Under lockdown 4.0, the Karnataka government has permitted the opening of barber shops, spas, parlors, and salons. These establishments will have to strictly abide by the Standard Operating Procedure issued by the Department of Health and Family Welfare. As per the SOP, persons with fever, cold, cough and throat pain should not be allowed on the premises. Those without masks, including staff members, should not be permitted inside, while all the staff have to wear masks, head cover, and apron at all times, apart from sanitizing hands after every haircut.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Personal Grooming Businesses (e.g. hair salons)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: India on 19 May 2020, Bengaluru, Karnataka. Under lockdown 4.0, the Karnataka government has permitted the opening of barber shops, spas, parlors, and salons. These establishments will have to strictly abide by the Standard Operating Procedure issued by the Department of Health and Family Welfare. As per the SOP, persons with fever, cold, cough and throat pain should not be allowed on the premises. Those without masks, including staff members, should not be permitted inside, while all the staff have to wear masks, head cover, and apron at all times, apart from sanitizing hands after every haircut.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Personal Grooming Businesses (e.g. hair salons)
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description:
India, Yoga and physical activity being important for health & well-being, it has been decided to open yoga institutes and gymnasiums from 5th August, 2020. Yoga Institutes and Gymnasiums shall adhere to protocols and prevention measures outlined in this document to prevent the spread of COVID-19. The generic preventive measures include simple public health measures that are to be followed to reduce the risk of COVID-19. These measures need to be observed by all (members, visitors & staff) in these places at all times.These include:
i.Individuals must maintain a minimum distance of 6 feet as far as feasible.
ii.Use of face covers/masks is mandatory at all times with in the premises. However,during yoga exercise or exercising in gymnasiums, as far as possible only a visor may be used. Use of mask (in particular N-95 masks) during exercise may cause difficulty in breathing. Respiratory etiquettes to be strictly followed. This involves strict practice of covering one's mouth and nose while coughing/sneezing with a tissue/handkerchief/flexed elbow and disposing off used tissues properly. Ensure 6 feet distance between personal trainer and clients during personal training sessions.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all indoor spaces
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
enforcer: Ministry/Department of Health,Provincial/State Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Disallowing sharing of notebooks, pens/pencils, water bottles, etc among students, the prohibition of assemblies and sports, encouraging online learning, entry of asymptomatic persons are some of the (India's) health ministry's guidelines for a partial reopening of schools for students of Classes 9 to 12 from 21 September on a voluntary basis. However, written consent of the students' parents or guardians will be required and such visits for teacher-student interactions must be organized in a staggered manner, the guidelines stated.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education

description: In the state of Assam in India wearing face masks and social distancing during the Chhath Puja is required. Children below 10 years of age and adults over the age of 65 are recommended to stay home. If symptomatic, testing is also recommended starting 16th October 2020.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: The state of Assam in India establishes a sop for cinemas and other public places. Proper crowd management required in parking lots, and outside the premises of cinemas/theaters/multiplexes. All social distancing guidelines should be followed at all times, including inside elevators, lobbies, restrooms, etc. Avoid overcrowding in these areas and food and drinks are also restricted from inside theatres. Staggered timings for shows should also be employed to avoid overcrowding. All payments are recommended to be online and non-contact, floor markers should also be used to follow social distancing.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries

description: On 4th April 2021, the Government of Maharashtra under the provision of the Epidemic Act 1897 announced the closure of all beaches/ gardens/ public grounds from 8 PM to 7 AM on weekdays and from 8 PM Friday to 7 AM Monday. The policy comes in effect from 8 pm on 5th April 2021 and will continue till 30th April 2021. Between 7 AM to 8 PM on Monday to Friday, visitors follow strictly Covid Appropriate Behaviour. Local authorities to ensure that such places are closely supervised and in case of crowding occurring in such locations to a point where the local authorities feel that it behaviour of visitors is not disciplined and may lead to transmission/ spread of the COVID-19 virus, then they may close down the same.
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Beaches
target_geog_level: One or more provinces within one or more countries
